alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 2:54PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following county...Hunterdon. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM EDT, spotter and gage reports indicate heavy rain across portions of the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Rainfall rates over two inches per hour are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Sand Brook and Sergeantsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
